parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To defraud, deprive of, despoil; mid: I endure deprivation; pass: To be bereft of. From apo and stereo; to despoil.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A field-laborer; then: a laborer, workman in general. From ergon; a toiler; figuratively, a teacher.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To mow, reap, collect. From hama; properly, to collect, i.e. reap.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A shout, cry. From boao; a halloo, i.e. Call.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To reap, gather, harvest. From theros; to harvest.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) the ear, (b) met: the faculty of perception. Apparently a primary word; the ear.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Hosts, armies. Of Hebrew origin; armies; sabaoth, a military epithet of God.
